Package org.apache.wayang.core.plan.wayangplan

Interface LoopHeadOperator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Operator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DoWhileOperator, FlinkDoWhileOperator, FlinkLoopOperator, FlinkRepeatExpandedOperator, FlinkRepeatOperator, JavaDoWhileOperator, JavaLoopOperator, JavaRepeatOperator, LoopHeadAlternative, LoopOperator, RepeatOperator, SparkDoWhileOperator, SparkLoopOperator, SparkRepeatOperator
    public interface LoopHeadOperator
extends Operator
    Head of a LoopSubplan.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  LoopHeadOperator.State
      LoopHeadOperators can be stateful because they might be executed mulitple times.

    • Method Detail

      • getLoopBodyOutputs

        java.util.Collection<OutputSlot<?>> getLoopBodyOutputs()
        If this instance is the head of a loop, then return these OutputSlots that go into the loop body (as opposed to the OutputSlots that form the final result of the iteration).
        Returns:
        the loop body-bound OutputSlots

      • getFinalLoopOutputs

        java.util.Collection<OutputSlot<?>> getFinalLoopOutputs()
        If this instance is the head of a loop, then return these OutputSlots that form the final result of the iteration.
        Returns:
        the loop-terminal OutputSlots

      • getLoopBodyInputs

        java.util.Collection<InputSlot<?>> getLoopBodyInputs()
        If this instance is the head of a loop, then return these InputSlots that are fed from the loop body (as opposed to the InputSlots that initialize the loop).
        Returns:
        the loop body-bound InputSlots

      • getLoopInitializationInputs

        java.util.Collection<InputSlot<?>> getLoopInitializationInputs()
        If this instance is the head of a loop, then return these InputSlots that initialize the loop.
        Returns:
        the initialization InputSlots

      • getConditionInputSlots

        java.util.Collection<InputSlot<?>> getConditionInputSlots()
        Retrieve those InputSlots that are required to evaluate the loop condition.
        Returns:
        the condition InputSlots

      • getConditionOutputSlots

        java.util.Collection<OutputSlot<?>> getConditionOutputSlots()
        Retrieve those OutputSlots that forward the getConditionInputSlots().
        Returns:
        the condition OutputSlots

      • getNumExpectedIterations

        int getNumExpectedIterations()
        Returns:
        a number of expected iterations; not necessarily the actual value

        default LoopHeadOperator.State getState()
        Optional operation. Only ExecutionOperators need to implement this method.
